intro: Pseudolabatia penicillata, commonly known as the slender labatia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent tube-like structure. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
